alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Candler; Effingham; Screven (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 10:35PM EDT until September 02 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bulloch, Candler, Effingham, Jenkins and Screven. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Allendale, Hampton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1031 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated only light sprinkles moving across interior Southeast Georgia along the backside of Tropical Storm Idalia. While additional flooding is unlikely, flooding continues in many areas. Emergency Management officials report numerous roads, mostly dirt roads, are washed out. Never drive into areas where waters covers the road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Statesboro, Metter, Sylvania, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Varnville, Estill, Fairfax, Brooklet, Portal, Brunson, Gifford, Newington, Oliver, Furman, Scotia, Rocky Ford, Luray, Hunters and Captolo.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
